item.description:
The trail is relatively short, about .6 mile each way, and it is a consistent climb/descent.
A good workout. Smaller dogs may need a boost here and there
The views at the top were good, but less than I expected.

Recommendations: walking stick to ease the descent, lots of water, slow pace.

To emphasize fun I'd allot a little more than 2 hours.

Lots of birds and wildlife.


DIRECTIONS:

I293 North/RT 101 W (From Exit 2 - Mall area - clock 3.8 miles)
Route 114 towards Goffstown/Henniker (clock 2.4 miles)
LEFT onto Shirley Hill Rd (clock 2.3 miles)
- pass Oak Rise Horse Farm
- cross Wallace Rd
- Brien Rd on left go another 100 yds
- LEFT on Back Mountain Rd
- Stay on Back Mountain Rd for 2.7 miles
- Back Mountain Rd turns into Mountain Rd (at the intersection of Roby Rd - you'll see Brown Excavating, keep that building to your left)
- Stay on Mountain Rd, pass the Uncanoonuc Perennial Gardens. Mark your counter, the entrance to the trail is 1.1 miles from the Garden center.
- Slow down when you pass the Electric Lines/Fire Break that yields a great view. You're only .2 miles away from the trail at that point.

The meetup photo is the entrance to the trail. Look for the tree trunks & the WHITE DOTS
item.how_to_find_us: Hugo & I scouted out the terrain

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Uncanoonuc North Mountain -White Dot Trail
